card.name: A Few Trusty Lads
card.text: Playable only on your starting company in lieu of a minor item. You may not reveal an avatar. The company may contain 2 Orc leaders. All unique Orc-leaders in the company receive +3 EI against Orcs and you may start the game at one of their home sites. During your end-of-turn phase you may bring one resource or character from your sideboard to your play deck (or 3 to your discard pile). Discard this card if the company contains more than 2 unique leaders, a non-Orc leader, or more than 2 non-Orc character. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: A Worthy Substitute
card.text: Playable on a Darkhaven [K]. Your characters at the site may transfer any ally they control to other characters of the same or higher mind (Ringwraiths may transfer and be transferred to) that do not control an ally of the same type. Afterwards, tap the ally if untapped. Discard this card when the site leaves active play. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

card.name: Abduction
card.text: Prisoner. Minion only. Playable during CvCC, if your company has at least twice as many characters as opponent's company. Instead of making a body check for 1 of opponent's characters (or for 2 Hobbits) place him with this card under the control of a non- wounded character in the company: he is taken prisoner with the company. Discard this card if the controlling character becomes wounded; the prisoner(s) forms a company at his current or new site. This card and the prisoner(s) may be stored at a Darkhaven [K], Dark-hold [D] or Shadow-hold [S]. Rescue attack: the duplicate of one of the site's automatic-attacks (your choice). Discard this card at the end of the current phase, if no character is associated with it.

card.name: Abhorred Ring
card.text: Spirit Ring. Playable only with a gold ring and after a test indicates a Spirit Ring. -2 to bearer'’s mind (to a minimum of 1). Bearer may tap to discard a hazard permanent-event played on his company or a character in his company. Bearer makes a CC. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Adûnaphel's Lute
card.text: Unique. Playable on Adûnaphel the Ringwraith at any non-Free-hold [F] site in The Sunlands (does not tap the site). Cannot be transferred. This item affects Adûnaphel; she gains the sage skill and is not taken to hand on a body check of 7 or 8. +2 to any CC from magic cards played by your characters at or moving to a site in the region of Adûnaphel's current site, or regions adjacent to this. Any CC made for spells or by opponent's Man or Dúnadan characters in these regions is modified by -2. tap: during end-of-turn phase to take Heralded Lord or No Escape from My Magic from your discard pile to your hand.

card.name: Ambushed
card.text: Playable on a non-detainment hazard creature attack by Orcs, Trolls, Dwarves, DÃºnedain, Elves, or Men, against a moving company that has not yet faced an attack this phase; does not count against the hazard limit. Attacker chooses defending characters for the attack.

card.name: Ard Once Vain
card.text: Black player only. Place this card on Adûnaphel the Ringwraith if in play as your Ringwraith: she becomes a Warlord and a leader. You may play this card in lieu of a minor item in your starting company and start the game at Lugarlur; Adûnaphel gains this site as a home site. If on Adûnaphel, all your Dúnadan characters cost one less influence to control. Discard this card to take Adûnaphel's Lute from your discard pile to your hand. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Arda Marred
card.text: Environment. Discard one Spring of Arda in play (your choice). Whenever an environment hazard or a magic resource is played, one token is added to one copy of Arda Marred in play (your choice). Discard 2 tokens from this card to play a hazard creature not counting against the hazard limit. If there are at least 4 tokens on this card you may discard it (at any time) to cancel an action by your opponent allowing him to take a resource from his sideboard or discard pile.

card.name: Aryen
card.text: Unique. Agent. Grey Agent. +3 EI against animal factions. tap: cancel an Animal, Spider or Wolf attack against his company. Agent only: tap: allow any non-unique Animal, Spider or Wolf hazard creature to be played at his Border-hold [B] or Ruins & Lairs [R] site this turn. The creature must be keyable to a non-Coastal Sea region.

card.name: Ash-drake
card.text: Drake. 2 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. May be played keyed to Gorgoroth, Nurn and Udûn. If Drought is in play may also be played keyed to Khand, Nûrad and Nuriag. May also be played keyed to a region affected by Awaken the Earth's Fire or keyed to any Volcano site.

card.name: Banishment
card.text: Sage only. Playable on a site with an Undead automatic-attack. Tap the sage. The site loses its all its Undead automatic-attacks. Sage makes a CP modified by -3. Discard if the company plays an item at the site or if the site leaves active play.

attr.value: Orcs -- each character faces a strike with 8 prowess

Stolen Knowledge. Place this card in your mp instead of discarding it from play: you may then discard this card to cancel all attacks from Mordor in Arms or from Barad-wath against one of your companies.
Orcs -- each character faces a strike with 7 prowess (detainment against overt companies)
while this site is play, any hero company moving between Nurn and Gorgoroth faces an attack: Orcs - 4 strikes with 9 prowess.

card.name: Bat-winged Helmet
card.text: Unique. Playable on Ûvatha the Ringwraith at any non-Free-hold site in The Sunlands or Great Central Plains (does not tap the site). Cannot be transferred. This item affects Ûvatha; he can use Shadow-magic and cannot be taken to hand on a body check of 7 or 8. tap: instead of Ûvatha whenever a card is played on him or his company that requires a scout or ranger to tap.

card.name: Behind the Hedge
card.text: Playable on a scout or ranger agent. If during the organization phase target agent is at a site where an opponent's company is present, opponent must reveal his hand to you. The agent may then take an extra agent action that turn or move 3 regions when moving. Discard after an attack by the agent. Cannot be duplicated on a given agent.

card.name: Beijabar Bees
card.text: Vermin, Animals. 20 strikes. Playable if Doors of Night is not in play. Detainment. May be played keyed to Anduin Vales, Beornâ€™s House, Rhosgobel, The Carrock, and Ligr Wodaize Berne. May not be played against a company containg a character with one of these sites as a home site. May also be played as a resource short-event by such a character when CvCC is declared (during any turn; before strikes are assigned): opponentâ€™s company faces an attack by Beijabar Bees.

card.name: Black Ring of Arda
card.text: Unique. Spirit Ring. Playable with a gold ring and only after a test indicates a Spirit Ring. Gives bearer warrior, scout, ranger, sage, and diplomat skills. Bearer must make a CC each time this card untaps. tap: if bearer is already a warrior to remain untapped against any strike this turn; tap: if already a scout to cancel a strike directed against any character in the company; tap: if already a ranger during organization phase to allow his company to move an extra region; tap: if already a sage to allow a character in his company to use magic this turn;tap: if already a diplomat to give +4 to an influence check he makes.

card.name: Black Steed
card.text: Horse. Playable at a tapped or untapped Border-hold [B] in Mordor or its adjacent regions. Cannot be controlled by an overt character. If each Ringwraith in a company controls a Black Steed, the company is in Black Rider mode. tap: cancel a strike from a non-automatic- attack against its bearer or itself. If each character in the company controls a horse ally, they may move 2 additional regions.

card.name: Blades of Sorcery
card.text: Playable on a Ringwraith company. For each successful strike in CvCC by a Ringwraith in the company, you may place a Morgul-knife or The Pale Sword on the defeated character instead of making a body check (character is still wounded); these may be taken from your discard pile if the Ringwraith bore a Morgul- blade or The Fiery Blade during CvCC this turn. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Bloodspike
card.text: Unique. Hoard Item. Weapon. May only be borne by a Troll. Warrior only: +2 prowess (+4 prowess to a maximum of 10 against Dúnedain and Men).

card.name: Bolvag
card.text: Unique. Sauron only. Playable at Minas Durlith. May use shadow-magic, spirit-magic and sorcery. He may play factions at Barad-dûr and Minas Durlith as if he were a leader and with +5 to the influence attempt. You may eliminate an Orc in his company to untap these sites. Discard Bolvag if his company moves to a site not in Udûn, Gorgoroth, Imlad Morgul or Nurn, or to an Under-deeps site with a surface site not in these regions.

card.name: Bone-basher
card.text: Unique. Only playable at a site with an Orc automatic-attack. Weapon. Two-handed. Warrior only: +2 prowess (+4 if Doors of Night is in play) (to a maximum of 10); -2 to target's body.

card.name: Breeder's Stock
card.text: Command. Playable on one of your Warlords.tap: make a roll and add your P total. If the result is less than 6, discard this card; if the result is more than 8, you may take a non-unique Orc or Troll character playable at your Warlord’s current site from your discard pile to your hand. Otherwise nothing happens.Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Broken Heirlooms
card.text: All (stage) resource effects that would modify the mp of an item, ally or faction to be worth more than their normal mp (as listed on their card) are cancelled. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Brutal Commands
card.text: Playable on a Warlord or a leader. +1 to opponent's P. Whenever a command card is played on target character or a roll is made for a command card controlled by him, opponent makes a body check for another character in the company (defender's choice). Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Bulrakur
card.text: Unique. Leader. Scara-hai. Black player only. +3 EI against Scara-hai. +2 prowess against all strikes that are not from Dragon, Drake, Dwarf, Dúnadan, or Pûkel-creature attacks. Cannot use any weapon. When Counterfeit is played on Bulrakur, ignore its normal effect, but he may use a weapon.

card.name: Call to Arms
card.text: Command. Playable on one of your Warlords. tap: make a roll and add your P total. If the result is less than 6, discard this card; if the result is more than 8 you may take a faction playable at your Warlord’s current site from your discard pile to your hand. Otherwise nothing happens.Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Captain no More
card.text: Playable on a leader at the same site as a War-lord you control. Fallen Saruman may also play this card if he has Bad Company in play. The leader’s EI is 0 and he may not have any followers. The character is not considered to be a leader while bearing this card. Return any command cards to your hand. You may discard this card at any time, if target character is in the company with a War-lord.

card.name: Caran-carach
card.text: Unique. Demon. Wolf. 1 strike. As a creature, may also be played keyed to Southern Mirkwood, Dol Guldur, and The Sulfur-deeps. Any body check resulting from the attack is modified by +1 (unless the defending character bears any armor or a shield). As a short-event, one Wolf hazard creature may be played keyed to a Border-hold [B] this movement/hazard phase.

card.name: Cham-en-Faroth
card.text: Unique. Mind Ring. Playable on The Grimburgoth at any site where rings are playable (or at Dol Guldur if a manifestation of Khamûl the Easterling is in play). +2 on bearer’s CC from magic cards. +2 prowess against ringbearers in CvCC. Place any defeated creature affected by a sorcery card played on the company with this ring. For every 2 creatures placed with this card all creature attacks against the company suffer a -1 modification to prowess and body.

card.name: Circle of Swords
card.text: Magic. Sorcery. Playable on a sorcery-using character facing an attack, before strikes are assigned. For every weapon item in the company you may assign one strike of the attack to the sorcery-using character (regardless of his status or the attack's abilities). The prowess and body of such a strike is modified by subtracting any bonus the corresponding weapon gives against it (regardless of the bearer's race or skills). Unless he is a Ringwraith, target character makes a CC modified by -4.

card.name: Creating Their Domain
card.text: Playable on your Ringwraith. Your Ringwraith'’s company may move with region movement to any site in the same region as one of his home sites. Bade to Rule is not discarded when moving through such a region. Additionally, if at one of his home sites you may play Black Rider and Heralded Lord on your Ringwraith and he may use any of his abilities as if at a Darkhaven [K].

card.name: Consumed by Dragon-fire
card.text: Playable during the site phase at a Dragon's lair if your company there bears a unique hero item (not a manifestation of The One Ring). Place the hero item in your out of play pile: any influence attempt against a Dragon faction at the site this turn is modified by the number the removed item would give as if discarded for the attempt (a special item is considered a greater item). Place this card in your mp: unless you are a Dragon-lord it gives 2 mp.

card.name: Contested Powers of Mirkwood
card.text: Playable if you are Sauron or a Warlord. You may tap your avatar to bring this card into play from your sideboard. Each time you successfully play Smoke on the Wind or Burning Rick, Cot, and Tree at a site in Mirkwood or Anduin Vales, place it with this card. If at least three such cards are placed with this card, it gives 3 mp and each hero company moving through a region of Mirkwood faces an attack at the beginning of their movement/hazard phase: Orcs â€” 3 strikes with 7 prowess. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Cracking Whip
card.text: Playable on a Whip. May be played with your starting company in lieu of a minor item. If the bearer of target Whip is a leader, during the organization phase you may tap the Whip and make a body check modified by -1 for another character in his company; if still in play afterwards, that character may untap and his company may move an extra region that turn. Cannot be duplicated on a given item.

card.name: Cult of the Long Night
card.text: Cult. Playable on a sage at Nan Morsereg if you eliminate a trophy or prisoner from the company. While Doors of Night is in play, target character gains +1 prowess and body, and +1 to his CP from using magic resources. If you have more than one copy of Cult of Long Night in play, this card gives 1 faction mp. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Cult of the Dark Lord
card.text: Black player only. Cult. Playable on a Man-hold in Mordor, Bay of Ormal, The Sun-lands, or the Great Central Plains, where you have a unique faction in play. Eliminate one of your characters at the site (or a prisoner in the company). The site becomes one of your Darkhavens [K]. All automatic-attacks against your company at the site are cancelled; any automatic-attacks at other versions of the site become normal attacks. Discard if you do not have a unique faction in play at the site or when the site leaves active play. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

card.name: Curse the Baggins!
card.text: Black player only. Playable if you have Stinker at Dol Guldur (or Barad-dûr if you are Sauron). Place this card and Stinker off to the side; Stinker is concidered Prisoner at Dol Guldur. Each untap phase he must make a body check modified by +1; if still in play afterwards you may discard Stinker and take My Precious from your discard pile or play deck to your hand. If Stinker is eliminated place this card in your mp: it is worth 1 ally mp and your ring tests at Bag End are modified by +3.

card.name: Dark Designs of Mordor
card.text: Each player may take one Angmar Arises, In Darkness Bind Them, Growing Shadow or Reaching Shadow from his discard pile to his hand during the end-of-turn phase.

card.name: Dark Embassy
card.text: Diplomat only. Black player only. Playable on a non-overt diplomat. You may play In the Name of Mordor on target diplomat to cancel any detainment automatic- attack of the same type as the diplomat's race or as a unique faction you have in play. If an automatic-attack is so cancelled, any influence attempt made against a faction or character of that type/race at the site the same turn is modified by +2. Additionally, if Faithless Steward is played on target diplomat he need not tap to play In the Name of Mordor.

card.name: Dark Forges
card.text: Sage only during the site phase at an untapped site where Information is playable. Tap the sage and the site. Sage may not untap until Dark Forges is stored at a Darkhaven [K]. During your organization phase, you may tap a sage at a Darkhaven [K] and discard a stored Dark Forges to retrieve any one or two non-unique non-hoard minor or major battle-gear or technology items from your discard pile. These must be placed under the control of characters in the sage's company.

card.name: Dark Shapes Gathered There
card.text: Non-unique Spider and Awakend Plant creatures without an asterisk (*) may be played keyed to Lotan and any region in Mirkwood; and at sites in these regions if Reaching Shadow is in play. Additionally, after a failed influence attempt at a site in Mirkwood the influencing hero character makes a CP. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Dark Spires Rising
card.text: Unique. Black player only. Playable during the site phase on Barad-dûr, if Foundations Remain is inverted. Tap a character with a mind greater than 5 at the site or discard this card. You may play Hold Rebuilt and Repaired at Barad-dûr and invert this card. If inverted, this card is worth 2 mp, all versions of Barad- dûr are now considered a Dark-hold [D] and cards normally storable at Barad-dûr may be stored there. All sites in Gorgoroth and Udûn are restored to their normal site type. Replace The Necromacer for either Sauron or The Lidless Eye (which may be taken from sideboard).

card.name: Dawnless Day
card.text: Unique. Sauron only. Any Ringwraith and Sauron player may discard a mode card from the company during their organization phase and replace it with another mode card from hand. Aditionally, at the end of the organization phase, they may heal any Ringwraith (from wounded to tapped) or untap all Ringwraith followers. During your organization phase rotate this card 90°; discard this card when rotated 180°.

card.name: Deadly Laughter
card.text: Minion only. Until the end of the turn, you may tap your avatar or a magic using character to cancel a Maia attack against his company or a Maia event in play.

card.name: Death-carrying Vermin
card.text: Disease. Playable on a character after a successful strike from a Vermin attack, if Doors of Night is in play. Target character must make a body check; failing this check only wounds the character. If not wounded after the check, discard this card. Target character must make a body check modified by -3 at the beginning of each of his untap phases. Any effect that would normally heal the character removes this card instead. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Djerul
card.text: Unique. Can use spirit-magic. tap: shuffle one Poisonous Despair from your sideboard or discard pile into your play deck.

card.name: Dog-lord of Waw
card.text: Black player only. Place this card on Dwar the Ringwraith if in play as your Ringwraith. You may play this card with your starting company in lieu of a minor item. Dwar may come into play at any site with a Wolf automatic-attack. If on Dwar, he becomes a Warlord and a leader. You may always assign strikes to wolf allies in Dwarâ€™s company, regardless of their status or the attackâ€™s ability. Discard to take GÃ© of Ogamur from your discard pile to your hand. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Dragon-helm of Uon
card.text: Unique. Playable on Khamûl the Ringwraith at any non- Free-hold [F] site in Wilderland or the Great Central Plains (does not tap the site). Cannot be transferred. This item affects Khamûl; he gains the scout skill and cannot be taken to hand on a body check of 7 or 8. The prowess of any strike against Khamûl from a Dragon or Drake attack is modified by -2. Khamûl’s company may play any type of gold ring item at sites where gold ring items are playable.tap: shuffle Black Rain to your play deck instead of discarding it from play.

card.name: Dungeons of Dol Guldur
card.text: Playable on Dol Guldur. If your Warlord is at Dol Guldur, your rolls for Breeder'€™s Stock are automatically successful. You may tap a Ringwraith or leader at the site to discard this card. When this card is discarded, you may take one Drums or a non-unique Orc or Troll character from your sideboard to your hand. Discard when the site leaves active play. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

attr.value: (1st) Orcs 4 — strikes with 7 prowess (2nd) Wolves — 3 strikes with 8 prowess
Stolen Knowledge. Were-wolf may always be played keyed to the site. You may place this card with a company leaving the site; discard this card to cancel a Demon or Wolf attack the company faces.
Orcs. Wolves — 2 strikes with 8 prowess (detainment against Black player's companies; normal against other player's companies)

If Counterfeit is played on an Orc at this site, target Orc is considered a Scara-hai instead of a Half-orc (invert Counterfeit). Any non- unique wolf ally is playable at this site by a Scara-hai Orc.

card.name: Ear in the King's Court
card.text: Playable on a Dúnadan if opponent has Return of the King in play, or on a Dwarf if opponent has King under the Mountain or Lord of Dwarrowdelf in play. While your Dúnadan bearer is at the same site as a manifestation of Aragorn II, or your Dwarf bearer is at the same site as The Lord of Dwarrowdelf or The King under the Mountain Dwarf, Information is playable at the (tapped) site, all factions in play at the site are worth 1 less mp, and this card is worth 2 mp. Discard this card during your end-of-turn phase if target character is not at that same site.Cannot be duplicated for a given race.

card.name: Elf-skin War Drum
card.text: Instrument. Each leader in the company is considered to control a Tribal Banner for the purpose of Marching Companies. tap: take one command card from your discard pile to your hand. tap: make one non-unique Troll ally playable at an untapped Shadow-hold [S] Orc-hold this turn (regardless of any other requirements).

card.name: Evil Entered Secretly
card.text: Each time an agent or Nazgûl attacks, or a company enters Dol Guldur or a site in Mordor, add a token to this card. You may (at any time) remove one token from this card to modify the prowess of an agent or Nazgûl attack by +1, or to modify a CP by a character at or moving to a site in Mirkwood or Mordor by -1. Discard after the last token is removed from this card. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Eyes in Their Service
card.text: Playable if Saruman or The Lidless Eye is in play. For each face up agent you have in play at a site, one other agent may move to and/or be at the same site without using a site from the location deck. Additionally, once per turn you may use one against the hazard limit to untap or turn face down one of your agents. Discard when your play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Failed Leadership
card.text: Playable on a leader. +1 to opponent's SP.-3 to any roll made for a command card controlled by target character. If target leader is a minion avatar and opponent has 5 P or more, his +5 GI useable only to defend against influence attempts is reduced to 0. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Favoured by the Eye
card.text: Black player only. Playable on your avatar at Dol Guldur,if you have more mp of unique items and killed creatures than any opponent. Target character becomes a leader and may control any number of command cards; these do not modify his EI. Threats is not considered a skill card for your avatar and he may play Threats on any influence attempt (as if influencing a faction) or detainment strike (modify the roll by adding his prowess to a maximum of 6).Discard this card if Favoured by The Eye is played by another player. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Feagwath
card.text: Unique. Black player only. Leader. Can use shadow-magic. +2 EI against Orcs and Undead. tap: cancel a non-unique Undead attack against his company.

card.name: Fizzling Torch
card.text: tap: modify the prowess of an Animal, Spider,Wolf or Awakened Plant attack by -2. Alternatively, a ranger bearer may tap this item to cancel a non-automatic Awakened Plant attack.

card.name: Forgot His Orders
card.text: Playable on a leader. Make a roll and add opponent's P total; if the result is greater than 7, one No More Nonsense, Obey Him or Die, or command card target leader controls must be discarded (defender's choice). Opponent may discard Orders from Lugbúrz or Orders from the Great Demon from the company to cancel this effect.

card.name: Foundations Remain
card.text: Unique. Black player only. You may start with this card in lieu of a minor item. When Hold Rebuilt and Repaired is played on Barad-dûr, it is never discarded or returned to the site deck and you may tapap 3 characters with at least 3 different skills during the site phase at Barad-dûr to invert this card. If inverted, this card is worth 2 mp and you may play unique resources at sites in Mordor.

card.name: Fruitless Victory
card.text: Playable if opponent's company has defeated your non-unique hazard creature this movement/hazard phase. Make a roll for the creature; if the result is greater than its normal mp plus 5, remove the creature from opponent's mp or out-of-play pile and shuffle it into your play deck; then remove this card from the game.

card.name: Gaurhir
card.text: Unique. Werewolf. Black player only. +1 prowess if Wake of War is in play (+2 if Doors of Night is in play). +2 EI against Scara-hai. Can use spirit-magic and sorcery. Glance of Arien and Fled into Darkness may be played on Gaurhir as though he were The Balrog.

card.name: Gaze Fixed
card.text: Sauron only. Stolen Knowledge. Tap one of your characters at a site where an opponent's company is present to place this card and one Eye of Sauron in play with opponent’s company. If with a company: +1 to the company’s hazard limit and -1 to any CC made by characters in the company. Eye of Sauron cannot be discarded until this card is discarded. If the company moves, opponent may make a roll at the end of the movement/hazard phase and add 1 for each scout in the company and 1 for each region moved through. If the result is greater than 13 discard this card. When this card is discarded place it in your mp (it is worth 1 mp). Cannot be duplicated on a given company.

card.name: Gé of Ogamur
card.text: Unique. Playable only by Dwar the Ringwraith at any non-Free-hold site in the Great Central Plains (does not tap the site). Cannot be transferred. This item affects Dwar; he may use spirit-magic and is not taken back to hand on a body check result of 7 or 8. Attacks from your Hounds of Sauron receive +1 to their prowess and strikes. tap: shuffle any Our Own Wolves into your play deck instead of discarding it from play this phase.

card.name: Goblin-miner
card.text: +1 prowess against Dwarves. Discard on a body check of 7. Costs no influence to control if controlled by an Orc or Troll leader bearing a Whip. +1 to his company's Under-deeps movement rolls.

attr.value: Any Under-deeps or surface site Orc-hold

card.name: Gorfaur the Lame
card.text: Unique. Troll. 1 strike. May also be played at Dol Guldur or following an Orc or Troll attack at a Shadow-hold [S] this phase. If Gorfaur the Lame is revealed (through the use of a card or ability) or played, characters in the current company receive -1 to their prowess and CC that phase.

card.name: Grachev Hos
card.text: Unique. +2 EI against characters and factions playable at sites in Nuriag or its adjacent regions. tap: take one Servants in the South and East from your discard pile to your hand. Sauron only: discard The Dark Power from hand to make a Man attack against his company detainment.

card.name: Grapnel
card.text: Playable on a non-Ringwraith covert company facing automatic-attack(s) at a Border-hold [B] or Free-hold [F]. Make a roll and add 1 for each scout in the company. If the result is greater than 8, cancel one automatic-attack at the site this turn.

card.name: Great Falcons of Mirkwood
card.text: Unique. Flying. Playable at Mountains of Mirkwood if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: none. tap: cancel an attack by a non-unique creature keyed to a region of Mirkwood (by single region type) against any of your moving companies. Cannot be played by an overt company.

card.name: Grimbúrz
card.text: Unique. Playable at Laek Goak; also playable at any Ruins & Lairs [R] in Wilderland by the bearer of Cham-en-Faroth, if the influence check is greater than 10.Standard Modifications: The Grimburgoth (+3), any faction playable at Dol Guldur (-2) tap: let a creature in opponent’s discard pile attack 1 of your companies, if that creature has already attacked the company this turn.

card.name: Growing Shadow
card.text: Sauron or War-lord only. Playable on a region card, if any of its adjacent Shadow-land [s] or Dark-domain [d] regions contains either your War-lord’s home site (Dol Guldur for The Necromancer) or a site where you have a unique faction in play. Target region is also considered a Shadow-land. Discard this card if you do not have such faction in play, or if your War-lord is at a site more than 3 regions away from his home site.

card.name: Gûrthlug

card.name: Hatred

card.name: Have You Seen Baggins?

card.name: He Wields Great Dominion

card.name: He's for Lugbúrz

card.text: Unique. Staff. Playable at Mistrand.+2 EI against Man characters and factions playable at sites in HarrhÃ»n or its adjacent regions. If bearer is a Man character with a mind of five or more, he can use spirit magic and receives +2 to his CP from using magic resources.

card.name: Second in Command
card.text: Playable on a non-unique Orc leader. May also be played in your starting company in lieu of a minor item. The leader may be in the company with another leader of a higher mind and gains an additional home site: any Shadow-hold [S] Orc-hold. Discard this card if no leader with a higher mind is in his company.

card.name: Servants in the South and East
card.graphics: Servants in the South and East.jpg
card.text: Minion only. As a permanent-event, playable on a leader bearing a Whip. Any Man faction playable at sites in Mordor or its adjacent regions and successfully influenced by target leader may be placed under his control. Discard such factions if the leader leaves active play. As a short-event, shuffle one faction playable at a site in Mordor or its adjacent regions from your discard pile into your play deck.

card.name: Severed Tokens
card.text: Trophy. Playable on a Foul Trophies in active play. This card is considered a prisoner of the types listed on Foul Trophies for the purpose of discarding or eliminating a prisoner. It yields 1 trophy mp. You may store both cards at a Darkhaven [K] for 1 mp. Cannot be duplicated on a given Foul Trophies.

card.name: Sharpen Up
card.text: Tap the bearer of a Saw-toothed Blade during the site phase at a Ruins & Lairs [R] and play this with the Saw-toothed Blade. Saw-toothed Blade receives +1 prowess (+3 against Elves and Maia). Cannot be duplicated on a given Saw-toothed Blade.

card.name: Slaves of Nurn
card.text: Unique. Playable at Ostigurth, if Hold Rebuild and Repaired is played on the site and if the influence check is greater than 8Standard Modifications: overt leader (+2; +4 if bearing a Whip), any Orc faction playable in Mordor (-2). tap: bring a food item from your discard pile to your play deck (reshuffle).Once in play the number to influence this faction is 0

card.name: Slipped out Quietly
card.text: Playable on an agent (not a grey agent). Target agent may tap to make Nazgul hazard creatures playable this turn at his current Border-hold [B] or Ruins & Lairs [R]; afterwards, return him to one of his home sites. Discard if the agent becomes wounded or is turned face down. Cannot be duplicated on a given agent.

card.name: Slew the Great Warrior
card.text: Warrior only. Trophy. Playable during the site phase on an untapped overt or minion warrior, if you have a unique Orcor Troll faction in play normally worth 3 mp; the site must be a Ruins & Lairs [R], Border-hold [B] or Free-hold [F] in the same or adjacent region as where the faction is playable. Character must face an attack: Dúnadan — 1 strike with 13 prowess (cannot be cancelled, redirected or made ineffectual). Cannot be duplicated at a given site.

card.name: Slyardach
card.text: Unique. Demon. 1 strike. May be played at Dol Guldur and Sarn Goriwing. Attacker chooses defending characters. If Reaching Shadow is in play, may also be played at any non-Haven, non-Free-hold site in Mirkwood. +1 to any resulting body checks of defending non-avatar characters. Slyardach's attack is considered a Nazgûl attack for the purpose of playing and interpreting hazard events.

card.name: Soldiers of the Dark Lord
card.text: Each non-unique Orc hazard creature that normally has 3 or more strikes receives +1 strike (+2 if Shadow of Mordor is in play) and may be played keyed to Shadow-holds [S], Dark-domains [d], or Dark-holds [D]. Discard during the end-of-turn phase if an Orc hazard creature was defeated that turn. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Some Devilry at Work
card.text: Playable on a face-up agent (even an agent you have in play). The agent must return to one of his home sites (controlling player's choice), or be taken back to hand (along with any cards he controls) if none of his home sites are available.

card.name: Some Elvish Plot or Weapon
card.text: Playable during the site phase on a wounded Orc or Troll. Target character makes a body check modified by +2 (by +1 if a leader is in the company). If still in play afterwards, he may play an item normally playable at the site as though he were untapped (ignore any requirement that he must tap; character remains wounded). Otherwise the company faces all automatic-attacks again and the site phase immediately ends.

card.name: Sorrow Long Foreseen
card.text: Any player with at least 3 P cannot receive more mp from killed creatures and trophies than their P total (or half their P total if he is a Fallen-wizard). Additionally, Dragon-lords do not receive any mp for their non-unique Gathered Bones. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Spiders Huge and Horrible
card.text: Corruption. Disease. Target character makes a CC modified by -1 whenever his company faces a Spider or Vermin attack. During his organization phase, the character may tap to attempt to remove this card by making a roll; if the result is greater than 5, discard this card. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Spiders of Mirkwood
card.text: Unique. Playable at Mountains of Mirkwood if the influence check is greater than 12.Modifications: eliminate a character or Prisoner from the company to add a bonus to the roll equal to the eliminated character’s mind. If you have a mustering card in play, this faction may move to any region in Mirkwood.

attr.value: Men — 3 strikes with 8 prowess (detainment if the company includes a character with Strayhold as his home site).
Brigands may always be keyed to this site and receives +1 prowess and +1 strikes.
Tap an avatar or a diplomat at this site to take one Assassin or Thief from your discard pile to your hand (once per turn; tap the site if untapped).

card.name: Strong and Fell
card.text: Playable on an Orc or Troll. If target character is wounded, once per phase he may make a body check modified by +2 (by +1 if a leader is in the company) and (if still in play afterwards) play a resource event that requires one of his skills, as though he were untapped (ignore any requirement that he must tap). Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Sulfur-spawn
card.text: Unique. Spawn. Manifestation of Spider of the Môrlat. Playable at The Sulfur-deeps. The company faces an attack: Spider — 1 strike with 16 prowess (neither attack nor strikes can be cancelled; any successful strike eliminates the defending character). If this ally is not at The Sulfur-deeps or Dol Guldur during the organization phase, make a roll modified by -3; if the result is greater than the mind of this ally’s controlling character, he is eliminated.

card.name: Swarthy Sneering Fellow
card.text: Agent. Any company moving to his current site has its hazard limit increased by one. Agent only: When Swarthy Sneering Fellow is face up and attacks, you can choose for the attack to be at +3 prowess and detainment: if any of its strikes are successful, the company must store one Lost Knowledge, Stolen Knowledge, or Information card it controls (if available; attacker's choice).

attr.value: Hidden Site. A company must tap a scout and discard a Lost Knowledge card it controls to move to this site.
Hidden Site. A company must tap a scout and discard a Lost Knowledge card it controls to move to this site.

card.name: The Ashdurbuk
card.text: Unique. Playable on a unique Orc leader at a Shadow-hold [S] in Wilderland or its adjacent regions. Target character may control 2 command cards (these are not returned to hand automatically); if bearing a Whip he suffers no modification to his EI from these. Discard if another Orc leader with a higher mind is in play.

card.name: The Dark Plague
card.text: Unique. Disease. Each character in play controlling a disease must make a body check. Failing this body check only wounds the character (unless he was already wounded). Altenatively, play to take up to two disease cards from your discard pile to your hand.

card.name: The Enemy Is Watching
card.text: For every card a player is forced to reveal from hand during his company's movement/hazard phase, the hazard limit of his company is increased by one. For every two cards thus revealed, the hazard player may bring one hazard from his sideboard to his play deck (reshuffle); for every three cards thus revealed, the resource player must randomly discard one of the revealed cards. For either purpose, revealing his whole hand counts as revealing one card. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: The Goblins Are upon You!
card.text: Playable on a company facing an attack, if it contains at least 2 Orc characters. All Orcs in the company receive +1 prowess (+2 against Dwarves) and -1 body against this attack and the next attack. Cannot be duplicated on a given attack.

card.name: The Morgul-lord
card.text: Place on The Witch-king if in play as your Ringwraith: he becomes a Warlord. You may play this card in lieu of a minor item in your starting company and start the game at Carn Dûm; The Witch-king gains this site as a home site. The Iron Crown affects The Witch-king. Discard this card to take Sea-helm of Ciryatan or Vasamacil from discard pile into hand.Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: The Necromancer
card.text: Black player only. Manifestation of the Lidless Eye. Playable if you have not revealed a Ringwraith. You are Sauron, not a Ringwraith. You may not play Ringwraith characters. +3 to your GI. You may bring a resource or character from your sideboard to your play deck during your organization phase (or 3 to your discard pile). You may play agent characters as normal minion characters and all your agent characters require 1 less mind to control (to a minimum of 3). All your overt companies have their hazard limit increased by 1 (to a minimum of 3). Dol Guldur receives an additional automatic-attack against all other non-black players’ companies: Maia — 1 strike with 21 prowess (cannot be cancelled). Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: The Ongrum
card.text: Unique. Staff. +3 EI against Orc factions playable at sites in Mordor. If bearer is an overt leader, he may automatically influence any Orc faction playable only at Cirith Ungol. Discard this item to give bearer +3 prowess against a strike; after the strike, untap all tapped Orcs in his company.

card.name: The Ring's Dominion
card.text: Playable on your avatar if you have Powers Too Dark and Terrible or Spells Born of Discord in play. Instead of tapping to use a ring he bears, target character may make a CP and (if still in play afterwards) tap the ring. This may be done once and at any time during his turn. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: The Slow Torment of Years
card.text: Sauron specific. Playable on an opponent's character normally worth 2 mp or more taken prisoner with the company. If target character is at Dol Guldur (or Barad- dûr if Dark Spires Rising is in play) during your site phase make a body check and rotate this card 90°; all of opponent’s characters in play must make a CC modified by -1 for each time rotated (maximum of 4). If target character is eliminated place this card in opponent’s mp: it is worth -2 mp. Discard this card if target character is not taken prisoner.

card.name: The Unfaithful
card.text: Sauron only. Playable on a diplomat at Barad-dûr. Target diplomat receives +3 EI against hero factions playable at his home site. When he successfully influences a hero faction at a Border-hold [B] or his home site, the faction is not discarded but this card is placed with it. Discard any other cards placed with the faction and/or remove it from any other card it is placed with. Target faction cannot tap or untap. You now receive this card's mp. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: The Úlairi Arose
card.text: Playable on your Ringwraith at a Darkhaven [K], if your Ringwraith is in a mode. Discard all Ringwraith followers which are not in a mode. -6 to your GI (-3 if your are The Witch King). You may place one They Ride Together with this card; it is not discarded until this card is discarded. Discard this card when your play deck is exhausted.

card.name: Things Might Go Ill
card.text: Playable on a detainment attack created by a non-unique Dúnadan, Dwarf, Hobbit, Man, or Wose creature (or agent of this type), before strikes are assigned. The attack becomes a normal attack; any strikes that must still be resolved after the first successful strike of the attack, become detainment. If the attack is defeated, place this card with the creature (or agent) in opponent'€™s mp.

attr.value: (1st) Orcs — 3 strikes with 8 prowess; (2nd) Troll — 1 strike with 9 prowess
Hidden Site. Swamp. Tap a Dúnadan ranger with a home site in Gondor when revealing this site. Undead creatures keyed to this site receive +2 prowess.
Hidden Site. Swamp. Tap an Orc ranger when revealing this site. Undead creatures keyed to this site receive +2 prowess.

card.name: Tribute to Sauron
card.text: Sauron specific. Playable on a Border-hold [B] by an untapped diplomat in a covert company. Tap the diplomat. This site is never discarded or returned to the location deck. Cannot be duplicated on a given site or given turn. If a unique hero faction playable at the site is in play, you may place this card with the faction, which is then worth 1 less faction mp. A Wizard or Lord at the site may tap during the site phase to discard this card from faction or site.

card.name: Trophy-belt
card.text: May only be borne by an Orc or Troll. You may place any trophies the character bears with this item. If there are any trophies with Trophy- belt it cannot be transfered (unless bearer is eliminated). When bearer has more trophies than other characters in the company, he must always face the first strike of any attack that does not choose defending characters (regardless of his status). When this card has 3 mp worth of trophies, the bearer becomes a leader (if not already) and this item may be stored at a site where you have a unique Orc or Troll faction in play for 2 mp.

card.name: Twisted Trees
card.text: Sorcery. Playable on a Darkhaven [K], Dark-hold [D] or Shadow-hold [S]. A sorcery-using character here may tap and make a CP modified by -4; if still in play afterwards, place one non-unique Awakend Plant creature with this card, taken from your hand or your company at the site. Only one creature can be with this card at any time. It may be played against a company moving through the siteâ€™s region (or region adjacent), or discarded to cancel an Awakened Plant creature attack against one of your companies. Cannot be duplicated on a given site. Discard if the site leaves active play.

card.name: Ukôg
card.text: Unique. Uruk-hai. Leader. Discard on a body check result of 8. +2 prowess against Orcs. +1 EI against Orcs and Trolls. His company may normally move only three regions. If a strike against Ukôg in CvCC fails and he is untapped, the resulting body check is modified by +2 (tap Ukôg afterwards).

card.name: Ullis
card.text: Unique. Agent. Agent only: tap: at a company's new site to attack that company during their movement/hazard phase. tap: during the site phase to play Ransom from hand on a strike from Ullis.

card.name: Ulred
card.text: Unique. +2 EI against the Rivermen of the Anduin Vales faction. Discard a Bridge, Forced March, or Down the Hurrying Waters from hand to cancel a River or Enchanted Stream played against his company before it resolves. tap: if at a port-on-river site to bring one of the above named cards from your discard pile to your play deck and shuffle.

card.name: Underneath the Shadow
card.text: Environment. Each player’'s hand size is reduced by one (by two if Morgul Night is in play). If Skies of Fire is in play, each minion player'’s hand size is increased by one. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Use with Terrible Effect
card.text: Sauron only. You may tap a ringbearer to bring this card into play from your sideboard. Whenever you successfully play a Dragon faction having modified the influence attempt by discarding an item, place the faction with this card. If there are factions with this card normally worth 11 mp or more, these are non-Dragon factions for the purpose of playing Long Grevious Siege, and your Fever of Unrest require one fewer Wilderness [w] to play a Dragon hazard creature (two fewer if used with Smaug).

card.name: Valleys Have Ears
card.text: Playable on your Ringwraith. Tap your Ringwraith during the organization phase to look at a number of cards from the top of any play deck equal to double the number of factions you have in play at sites in his current region or regions adjacent to this. If your own play deck, you may choose and take one of these cards to hand; return the others to the top of the play deck in any order you choose.

card.name: Vampire
card.text: Demon. Flying. 1 strike. Cannot be played against black players' companies. Cannot be cancelled by cards or abilities that require the scout or ranger skill. May also be played against a company that has faced a non-detainment Nazgûl or Spawn attack this turn. Only one Vampire can be played during a given movement/hazard phase.

card.name: Variag Horse-raiders
card.text: Men. Five strikes. Playable keyed to Horse Plains, Nuriag, NÃ»rad, Khand, and Chelkar; and to adjacent regions if Doors of Night is in play. The attack is detainment if opponent is Ã›vatha or has the Variags of Khand faction in active play. A character with a home site in the above named regions can tap to cancel this attack.

card.name: Variag-king of Khand
card.text: Place this card on Ûvatha the Ringwraith if in play as your Ringwraith; he becomes a Warlord and a leader. You may play this card in lieu of a minor item in your starting company and start the game at Mistrand; Ûvatha gains this site as a home site. Discard this card to take Bat-winged Helmet from your discard pile to your hand.Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Vasamacil
card.text: Unique. Playable on The Witch-king at any non-Free-hold [F] site in Eriador (does not tap the site). Cannot be transferred. This item affects The Witch-king; he may use sorcery and cannot be taken back to hand on a body check of 8. Any non-unique Undead hazard creature is keyable to the region of The Witch-king’s current site or site of destination.

card.name: Virsh
card.text: Unique. Scara-hai. Discard on a body check of 7 or 8. tap: during the site phase at an Orc-hold, if Host of Bats is in play or Swarm of Bats is played on his company, to play Poison from your discard pile or hand (tap the site if untapped).

card.name: Watch over Mordor
card.text: You may start the game with this card in lieu of playing a minor item. Once per turn, when you play a Stolen Knowledge card with a company at a site in Mordor, store it with this card, rotate this card 90Â°, and bring Mordor in Ruins into play from your sideboard (if not in play). When fully rotated, remove Mordor in Ruins from the game; this card now gives 4 mp (even to a Fallen-wizard) and you may play Tower Raided at any Dark-hold [D] in Mordor (as if at a Shadow-hold [S]).

card.name: Waulfa
card.text: Unique. +2 EI against factions playable at sites in Mirkwood. Healing cards Waulfa uses affect all characters in his company. -1 to his CC if in a company with an overt character.

card.name: We Are Fighting Uruk-hai!
card.text: Playable on a company containing an Uruk-hai facing an attack. All Uruk-hai in the company receive +2 prowess and -1 body against the attack. Cannot be duplicated against a given attack.

card.name: Were-wolf
card.text: Demon. Wolf. 1 strike. May also be played at a Ruins & Lairs [R] that has at least three Wildernesses [w] in its site path. Unless the defending character bears any armor, shield, or helmet, any resulting body check he makes is modified by +1. Only one Were-wolf can be played during a given movement/hazard phase.

card.name: Weapons of Morgul
card.text: Unique. During your organization phase you may discard a magic card to take up to 3 of the following cards (one copy of each card) from your play deck (reshuffle) or discard pile to your hand: Helm of Fear, Morgul- blade, The Fiery Blade, or an item only playable on your Ringwraith. If you are Sauron you may search for any Ringwraith specific item.

card.name: Widuskapin Ritual
card.text: Playable on Woodmen-town. Discard a minor item to heal (from wounded to untapped) a non-overt, non-Ringwraith character at Woodmen-town. Alternatively, discard this card to heal (from wounded to untapped) a character anywhere whose home site is Woodmen-town. Discard this card when Woodmen-town is discarded or returned to the location deck.

card.name: Winged Terror
card.text: Winged. Playable by a Ringwraith at a tapped or untapped Barad-dûr, Dol Guldur, or Minas Morgul. Return its controlling Ringwraith to your hand if this ally leaves active play. If the Ringwraith moves, discard any other allies he controls and/or any mode card in the company. If each Ringwraith in the company controls a Winged Terror or Creature of an Older World, the company is in Fell Rider mode and may move using starter movement. tap: allow its controlling Ringwraith to assign his strikes during CvCC regardless of his status.

card.name: Withstand the Nine
card.text: Any Nazgûl hazard creature may be played against a company that has faced a Nazgûl attack that movement/hazard phase; if played against a grey player's company such a creature does not attack normally as detainment. Discard at the end of the turn in which a Nazgûl hazard creature was played in this fashion. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Woedwyn
card.text: Unique. Agent. Can use sorcery. +1 EI against minion characters and factions playable at sites in Wilderland for each copy of Cult of the Long Night in play. Agent only: tap: when at one of his home sites to take one Brigands from your discard pile to your hand. This is considered an agent action.

card.name: Wolf-den
card.text: Playable on a Darkhaven [K], Dark-hold [D] or Shadow-hold [S], if you have a Wolf faction in play and an Orc faction in play at the site. Discard this card if you don’t have these factions in play. Once per organization phase you may search your discard pile or play deck (reshuffle) and take a wolf ally to your hand. Additionally, your wolf allies at this site heal from wounded to untapped during your untap face. Discard this card if the site leaves active play.

card.name: Wraiths of Mordor
card.text: Unique. Playable at Urlurtsu Nurn if the influence check is greater than 12. Standard Modifications: Ringwraith (+4), shadow-magic user (+2), spirit-magic user (+2). tap: untap your Ringwraith if at or moving to a site where an opponent's company is present. Every time a creature or characters is eliminated by your Ringwraith bearing a Morgul-blade or The Fiery Blade place them under this faction instead of your mp pile (the creature or character still gives normal kill points). This faction yields an additional mp for every card placed under it. Discard this faction if opponent plays Banishment at Urlurtsu Nurn (as if the site had an Undead automatic-attack)

card.name: Yellow-fanged Guard
card.text: Playable on a non-unique Orc. Target Orc need not tap to take a character or ally prisoner. If he controls a prisoner, he receives +1 prowess and body. Additionally, if you are a Fallen-wizard, target Orc becomes a Half-orc. If you are a black player, target Orc becomes a Scara-hai. Cannot be duplicated on a given Orc.

card.name: Zurtak
card.text: Discard on a body check result of 8. +1 EI against Orcs. If he bears a Whip, Zurtak becomes a leader and may tap to untap another Orc in his company. If you are Sauron, Zurtak receives +1 to his mind, prowess, body, and EI.
